pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:0.5: 49. The training rule on sticking out the tongue
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate sticking out their tongues. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.3: “‘I will not eat sticking out my tongue,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.4: One should not eat sticking out the tongue.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.5: If a monk out of disrespect eats sticking out his tongue, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.7: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.9: The ninth training rule is finished.
